refentry.refsect1:
&reftitle.description;
A "Locale" is an identifier used to get language, culture, or regionally-specific behavior from an API. PHP locales are organized and identified the same way that the CLDR locales used by ICU (and many vendors of Unix-like operating systems, the Mac, Java, and so forth) use. Locales are identified using RFC 4646 language tags (which use hyphen, not underscore) in addition to the more traditional underscore-using identifiers. Unless otherwise noted the functions in this class are tolerant of both formats.
Examples of identifiers include:
en-US (English, United States) zh-Hant-TW (Chinese, Traditional Script, Taiwan) fr-CA, fr-FR (French for Canada and France respectively)
The Locale class (and related procedural functions) are used to interact with locale identifiers--to verify that an ID is well-formed, valid, etc. The extensions used by CLDR in UAX #35 (and inherited by ICU) are valid and used wherever they would be in ICU normally.
Locales cannot be instantiated as objects. All of the functions/methods provided are static.
The null or empty string obtains the "root" locale. The "root" locale is equivalent to "en_US_POSIX" in CLDR. Language tags (and thus locale identifiers) are case insensitive. There exists a canonicalization function to make case match the specification.
&reftitle.methods;
getDefault - Gets the default locale value from the INTL global 'default_locale'
setDefault - sets the default runtime locale to $locale
getPrimaryLanguage - Gets the primary language for the input locale
getScript - Gets the script for the input locale
getRegion - Gets the region for the input locale
getAllVariants - Gets the variants for the input locale
getKeywords - Gets the keywords for the input locale
getDisplayName - Returns an appropriately localized display name for the input locale
getDisplayLanguage - Returns an appropriately localized display name for language of the input locale
getDisplayScript - Returns an appropriately localized display name for script of the input locale
getDisplayRegion - Returns an appropriately localized display name for region of the input locale
getDisplayVariant - Returns an appropriately localized display name for variants of the input locale
filterMatches - Checks if a $langtag filter matches with $locale according to RFC 4647's basic filtering algorithm.
lookup - Searchs the items in $langtag for the best match to the language
composeLocale - Returns a correctly ordered and delimited locale ID
parseLocale - Returns a key-value array of locale ID subtag elements.
